customer_addr:
9481 Pleasant Hill Rd NW
Dundee, OH 44624

citations.narrative:
A method of identification for puppies less than 16 weeks of age is not currently being used. Four puppies did not have
any form of identification at the time of inspection. Failure to ensure that puppies are identified properly impedes APHIS
officials ability to perform trace backs in the case of disease, theft, or loss. Class "A" dealers shall identify all live dogs on
the premises. Correct by ensuring proper identification is used, documented, and maintained for all dogs at the facility.
Correct by, 20-May-2025.

The facility is not maintaining a Record of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS form 7005). The facility was unable to provide
an APHIS form 7005 with the dogs present at the facility recorded. The facility currently has 16 adult dogs with 0 adult
dogs listed on the APHIS form 7005. Inaccurate or incomplete records do not allow for APHIS officials to perform a
complete inspection of the facility and does not facilitate proper tracking of animals. Correct by ensuring that the records
are fully and correctly disclosed for all dogs that are purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or
her possession or under his or her control. Correct by, 20-May-2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is an excessive accumulation of excreta in the outdoor runs of the adult dog enclosures. The licensee stated that
he had not spot cleaned the outdoor runs since 01-May-2025. Failure to provide adequate cleaning and sanitization in the
primary enclosures increases the risk of disease transmission, attracts insects/pests, and increases odors. Excreta could
potentially cause soiling on the body of the dog being housed in the affected enclosure. The licensee must remove
excreta and food waste from the primary enclosure daily and from under the primary enclosures as often as necessary to
prevent an excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs contained in the primary
enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. Correct by 12-May-2025.

The facility has not administered vaccinations for rabies, distemper, and parvo in the last year in accordance with the
schedule outlined in the program of veterinary care. Additionally, fecal testing for parasites and other pests have not been
conducted in accordance with the program of veterinary care. Failure to follow a written and Attending Veterinarian
approved schedule for vaccinations of contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and treatment of parasites and
other pests can result in increased risk of disease exposure and delay in treatment. The licensee must ensure that
vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus and distemper) and sampling
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are administered. Correct by, 20-May-2025.

The facility does not have records of treatments administered or the dates of administration in the adult dogs. A facility
representative stated that dewormer had been administered to all of the dogs but was not recorded. Additionally, there are
no records of veterinary treatments provided to the dogs. Failure to maintain records of vaccines and treatments
administered to the dogs does not allow for APHIS officials to determine if the veterinarian approved vaccination schedule
is being followed. The facility must ensure that the names of all vaccines and treatments administered, and the dates of
administration are recorded. Correct by, 20-May-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
A method of identification for puppies less than 16 weeks of age is not currently being used. Four puppies did not have 
any form of identification at the time of inspection. Failure to ensure that puppies are identified properly impedes APHIS 
officials ability to perform trace backs in the case of disease, theft, or loss. Class "A" dealers shall identify all live dogs on 
the premises. Correct by ensuring proper identification is used, documented, and maintained for all dogs at the facility. 
Correct by, 20-May-2025. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not maintaining a Record of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS form 7005). The facility was unable to provide 
an APHIS form 7005 with the dogs present at the facility recorded. The facility currently has 16 adult dogs with 0 adult 
dogs listed on the APHIS form 7005. Inaccurate or incomplete records do not allow for APHIS officials to perform a 
complete inspection of the facility and does not facilitate proper tracking of animals. Correct by ensuring that the records 
are fully and correctly disclosed for all dogs that are purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or 
her possession or under his or her control. Correct by, 20-May-2025. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There is an excessive accumulation of excreta in the outdoor runs of the adult dog enclosures. The licensee stated that 
he had not spot cleaned the outdoor runs since 01-May-2025. Failure to provide adequate cleaning and sanitization in the 
primary enclosures increases the risk of disease transmission, attracts insects/pests, and increases odors. Excreta could 
potentially cause soiling on the body of the dog being housed in the affected enclosure. The licensee must remove 
excreta and food waste from the primary enclosure daily and from under the primary enclosures as often as necessary to 
prevent an excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the dogs contained in the primary 
enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. Correct by 12-May-2025. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

The facility has not administered vaccinations for rabies, distemper, and parvo in the last year in accordance with the 
schedule outlined in the program of veterinary care. Additionally, fecal testing for parasites and other pests have not been 
conducted in accordance with the program of veterinary care. Failure to follow a written and Attending Veterinarian 
approved schedule for vaccinations of contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and treatment of parasites and 
other pests can result in increased risk of disease exposure and delay in treatment. The licensee must ensure that 
vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus and distemper) and sampling 
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are administered. Correct by, 20-May-2025. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not have records of treatments administered or the dates of administration in the adult dogs. A facility 
representative stated that dewormer had been administered to all of the dogs but was not recorded. Additionally, there are 
no records of veterinary treatments provided to the dogs. Failure to maintain records of vaccines and treatments 
administered to the dogs does not allow for APHIS officials to determine if the veterinarian approved vaccination schedule 
is being followed. The facility must ensure that the names of all vaccines and treatments administered, and the dates of 
administration are recorded. Correct by, 20-May-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
